title: Mass Media and Society in Germany from Empire to Third Reich
abstractText: This project aims to attain a fuller understanding of how the rapid expansion of mass communications and commercial entertainment fitted into the wider development of social, political and cultural life in Germany from c. 1900 to the outbreak of the Second World War. Straddling the Imperial, Weimar and Nazi periods, it analyses how the impact and meaning of 'mass culture' changed over time, and charts the effects on patterns of social distinction and political mobilization.
